faq.question: Do I have to collect and recheck my bags?
faq.answer: Yes, if you booked a self-transfer, your baggage won’t be moved automatically between flights. You’ll need to collect it and check it in again at your layover airport.

faq.question: Will I go through security again?
faq.answer: Usually, yes. You’ll likely exit and re-enter security, especially when changing terminals or airlines.

faq.question: What happens if I miss my flight?
faq.answer: Because each flight is a separate booking, missed connections are not automatically rebooked. But if your booking includes Mytrip's Self-Transfer Guarantee, you may be rebooked or refunded.

faq.question: Do I need a visa for my layover country?
faq.answer: Maybe. Even if you stay in the airport, some countries require a transit visa. Always check the rules for your layover country before flying.

faq.question: Can I check in for all flights at once?
faq.answer: No, each airline requires its own check-in. You’ll need to check in separately for every leg of your trip — online check-in is highly recommended.

faq.question: Can I travel with checked baggage?
faq.answer: You can, but it’s riskier. If your layover is short, there might not be enough time to collect and recheck your bags. Consider cabin bags only.

faq.question: What is the Self-Transfer Guarantee?
faq.answer: It’s protection from Mytrip that covers missed connections for eligible bookings. If a delay causes you to miss your next flight, we’ll help you get a new one or refund the unused leg.
